metadata.fieldPath: root.Team Setting Command.Team Setting Command
metadata.tooltip:
A chat command that players can type (e.g., "/shop", "/bank", "/home"). Commands usually start with "/" and are case-insensitive. See: umod.org/guides/the-basics/commands

Examples: /shop, /bank, /home, /tp

metadata.fieldPath: root.Enabled functions.Enabled functions
metadata.tooltip:
If true, this feature/item/skill is active and available. If false, it is disabled and hidden from players.

Examples: true, false

metadata.fieldPath: root.Enabled functions.Enabled functions.Enable auto teamleader switch(If current teamleader go offline, next player from online automaticcaly set to teamleader. Teamleader get his leader role after join online).Enable auto teamleader switch(If current teamleader go offline, next player from online automaticcaly set to teamleader. Teamleader get his leader role after join online)
metadata.description: If current teamleader go offline, next player from online automaticcaly set to teamleader. Teamleader get his leader role after join online
metadata.tooltip: If current teamleader go offline, next player from online automaticcaly set to teamleader. Teamleader get his leader role after join online

metadata.fieldPath: root.Enabled functions.Enabled functions.Enable team skins.Enable team skins
metadata.tooltip:
The numeric skin ID for an item. Skins change the appearance of items. Skin ID 0 means default/no skin. Find skins at: steamcommunity.com/market

Examples: 0, 13076, 10135

metadata.fieldPath: root.Permissions.Permissions
metadata.tooltip:
Array of permission node strings. Each permission controls access to specific features.

Examples: pluginname.use, pluginname.admin

metadata.fieldPath: root.Permissions.Permissions.Need permission for Team Hud?(true - will work only for players with permission / false - work for all players).Need permission for Team Hud?(true - will work only for players with permission / false - work for all players)
metadata.description: true - will work only for players with permission / false - work for all players
metadata.tooltip:
A permission node string (e.g., "pluginname.use", "pluginname.admin"). Permissions control access to plugin features. Format: usually "pluginname.action" or "pluginname.feature"

Examples: pluginname.use, pluginname.admin, betterteams.marker

metadata.fieldPath: root.Permissions.Permissions.Need permission for Team Voice?(true - will work only for players with permission / false - work for all players).Need permission for Team Voice?(true - will work only for players with permission / false - work for all players)
metadata.description: true - will work only for players with permission / false - work for all players
metadata.tooltip:

metadata.fieldPath: root.Hud Settings.Hud Settings.UI Scale.UI Scale
metadata.tooltip:
Multiplier for UI element size. • 1.0 = normal size (100%)
• 2.0 = double size (200%)
• 0.5 = half size (50%)

Affects all UI elements proportionally.

Examples: 0.5, 1.0, 1.5, 2.0

metadata.fieldPath: root.Hud Settings.Hud Settings.Left Offset.Left Offset
metadata.tooltip:
Distance in pixels to offset a UI element from its default position. Can be horizontal (X) or vertical (Y) offset. Positive values move right/down, negative move left/up.

Examples: 0.0, 5.0, 10.0, -5.0

metadata.fieldPath: root.Hud Settings.Hud Settings.Top Offset.Top Offset
metadata.tooltip:
Distance in pixels to offset a UI element from its default position. Can be horizontal (X) or vertical (Y) offset. Positive values move right/down, negative move left/up.

Examples: 0.0, 5.0, 10.0, -5.0

metadata.fieldPath: root.Hud Settings.Hud Settings.Player grid refresh rate.Player grid refresh rate
root.Hud Settings.Hud Settings.Lines margin.Lines margin
metadata.tooltip:
Space in pixels between UI elements or around content. Larger margins = more spacing. Used for card spacing, button gaps, etc.

Examples: 0.0, 5.0, 10.0

metadata.fieldPath: root.Hud Settings.Hud Settings.Collums margin.Collums margin
metadata.tooltip:
Space in pixels between UI elements or around content. Larger margins = more spacing. Used for card spacing, button gaps, etc.

Examples: 0.0, 5.0, 10.0

metadata.fieldPath: root.Hud Settings.Hud Settings.Max amount of player displays in line.Max amount of player displays in line
root.Skin List (Item Id - List of available skins).Skin List (Item Id - List of available skins)
metadata.description: Item Id - List of available skins
metadata.tooltip:
The shortname of a Rust item. Shortnames are lowercase identifiers with dots or underscores (e.g., "rifle.ak", "box.wooden.large").

Examples: rifle.ak, campfire, wood
